docs.snippet: LEAD: THE Bad Brains, who performed late Monday night at Club 1018, aren't just the best (and possibly only) Rastafarian hard-core-rock band. With power, noise, wild frenzy and pinpoint accuracy, they're a rock band whose visceral impact is absolu...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE Bad Brains, who performed late Monday night at Club 1018, aren't just the best (and possibly only) Rastafarian hard-core-rock band. With power, noise, wild frenzy and pinpoint accuracy, they're a rock band whose visceral impact is absolutely state-of-the-art. Formed in Washington, D.C., and based since 1979 in New York, the Bad Brains have built a considerable following among hard-core fans, dozens of whom slam-danced and dived into the crowd

docs.snippet: It was shortly after 2 A.M. yesterday when King Kino, the lead singer of Phantoms, a popular Haitian band, strolled to the microphone to address the packed house at Club Rendez-Vous in Flatbush, Brooklyn.    But this was not just another night at ...
docs.lead_paragraph: It was shortly after 2 A.M. yesterday when King Kino, the lead singer of Phantoms, a popular Haitian band, strolled to the microphone to address the packed house at Club Rendez-Vous in Flatbush, Brooklyn. But this was not just another night at the club. The hundreds of young Haitian immigrants had come to dance, but also to show solidarity with Abner Louima, who is in critical condition at the Brooklyn Hospital Center from injuries he received after his arrest at the club one week ago.
docs.abstract: Haitian immigrants gather at Club Rendez-Vous in Brooklyn to show solidarity with Abner Louima, who is in critical condition from injuries he received after his arrest at the club on Aug 9 (M)

headline.main: Solidarity At Arrest Site A Week Later

docs.snippet: Great shows used to be about fallen masculinity. Now they’re about collaboration and resilience. What changed?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Great shows used to be about fallen masculinity. Now they’re about collaboration and resilience. What changed?
docs.abstract: Lili Loofbourow Riff essay argues that new television series like Doll & Em, which are created by women and focus on women, are challenging widely-held assumptions about high-brow television programming, like importance of anti-heroes and dark narratives; notes in particular that these new shows avoid pitfall of resorting to nihilism or black comedy and often end on notes of character perseverance.

docs.snippet: Jack Nicklaus is threatening to make the 46th year of his life the most memorable to date - a year when this once young, strong, heroic golfer makes middle age a time of even bigger heroics.   He continued this trend today when he dropped a slippe...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jack Nicklaus is threatening to make the 46th year of his life the most memorable to date - a year when this once young, strong, heroic golfer makes middle age a time of even bigger heroics. He continued this trend today when he dropped a slippery, downhill, 15-foot birdie putt on the 18th hole to gain a tie for the lead halfway through his own tournament on his own course -the Memorial tournament at Muirfield Village Golf Club. When he became the oldest Masters winner last month, Nicklaus could have rested on his laurels for the rest of the year and longer without diminishing his stature as one of the game's greatest players. But here he is tied at eight-under-par 136 with Dan Halldorson of Canada, who is 34 years old; Don Pooley, also 34, and Doug Tewell, who is 36.

byline.original: By GORDON S. WHITE Jr., Special to the New York Times

docs.abstract: AMC's Breaking Bad wins total of five awards at 66th annual Emmy Awards, including its second consecutive prize for outstanding drama series, for final season; ABC's Modern Family wins award for best comedy series; results of awards show represents win for traditional television, with Netflix winning only one award for its prison comedy Orange Is the New Black.

docs.snippet: In the adaptable environment of La Mama Annex, Andrei Serban re-fought ''The Trojan Wars,'' Peter Brook sent the audience figuratively flying on a Persian carpet of a spectacle entitled ''The Conference of the Birds,'' and, last year, Ping Chong o...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the adaptable environment of La Mama Annex, Andrei Serban re-fought ''The Trojan Wars,'' Peter Brook sent the audience figuratively flying on a Persian carpet of a spectacle entitled ''The Conference of the Birds,'' and, last year, Ping Chong offered his sleekly modern ''Nosferatu.'' Earlier this season, in the same space, Tadeusz Kantor led his ensemble through a symbolic re-enactment of his life and times in 20th-century Poland. Starting Thursday, in a striking change of pace, the stage is being transformed into Harlem's legendary Cotton Club. In place of the tradi-tional banks of seats there will be tables and chairs. A large mirrored ball will hang from the ceiling, and on stage will be tap-happy dancers, the spangled Soubrettes, blues singers and vaudeville comedians, re-creating roles played at the original Cotton Club by such stars as Duke Ellington, Lena Horne and Cab Calloway. During the intermission, theatergoers will be invited to dance on stage. Actually the show will be a re-creation of a re-creation. Eleven years ago, Ellen Stewart presented her first ''Cotton Club-Gala.'' Some of the acts have changed, but the concept remains the same - a celebration of elegant nights uptown.

headline.main: LA MAM TAKES A BREAK FROM THE AVANT-GARDE
